clinical_study.brief_title: Renal Effects of RIPC in Patients After Total Arch Replacement
clinical_study.official_title: Renal Effects of Remote Ischemic Preconditioning in Patients After Total Arch Replacement

lead_sponsor.agency: Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, Fuwai Hospital

clinical_study.source: Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, Fuwai Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the hypothesis that remote ischemic preconditioning prevents acute kidney injury and improves clinical outcomes in patients undergoing total arch replacement.

detailed_description.textblock: Acute kidney injury (AKI) is a well-recognized complication after cardio-thoracic surgeries and is associated with increased morbidity and mortality. Total arch replacement is reported with a relatively high incidence of post-operative AKI. In addition, few effective preventive or therapeutic interventions for AKI have been identified. A number of studies have now addressed renal protection as a primary outcome following RIPC. Because the mechanism of I/R injury are similar to those proposed for AKI after CPB, the purpose of this study is to test the hypothesis that remote ischemic preconditioning prevents acute kidney injury and improves clinical outcomes in patients undergoing total arch replacement.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of AKI within the 7 days after the surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of severe AKI (stage 2 and stage 3)

arm_group.description: Remote ischemic preconditioning (RIPC) will be induced after the general anesthesia prior to the cardiopulmonary bypass by four cycles of right limber ischemia (5-min blood pressure cuff inflation to a pressure of 200mmHg or a pressure that is 50 mmHg higher than SAP and 5-min cuff deflation)
A deflated cuff placed on the right upper arm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients scheduled for total arch replacement
- written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- kidney transplantation
- peripheral vascular disease affecting the upper limbs
- preexisting AKI
- hybrid total arch replacement
